intro: Calonemorchis pendens, commonly known as the hanging bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves and specialized structures called bladders, which it uses to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and ditches. Calonemorchis pendens is a carnivorous plant, relying on the nutrients obtained from its prey to supplement its nutrient-poor environment. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
